sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee Act.

sections.heading: Legislative findings. The General Assembly finds that 1 in 10 young people ages 18-25 experience a form of homelessness over a 12-month period
sections.text: Also 1 in 30 youths ages 13-17 experience a form of homelessness over a 12-month period. Homelessness disproportionately impacts African-American youth and

sections.heading: Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee
sections.text: In 2016 the Governor, by Executive Order, created a Governor's Cabinet on Children and Youth to ensure that all children and youth in Illinois are healthy, safe, well-educated, and successfully launched into self-sufficiency. To better serve youth leaving

sections.heading: Duties. The Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee shall:
sections.text: Duties. The Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee shall:

sections.heading: Membership. The Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee shall include the following members:
sections.text: Membership. The Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee shall include the following members:

sections.heading: Quorum. A majority of the members of the Subcommittee shall constitute a quorum, and all recommendations of the Subcommittee shall require approval of a majority of the total members of the Subcommittee
sections.text: Quorum. A majority of the members of the Subcommittee shall constitute a quorum, and all recommendations of the Subcommittee shall require approval of a majority of the total members of the Subcommittee.

sections.heading: Administrative support. The Governor's Office shall provide administrative support to the Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee as needed, including with respect to compliance with State ethics laws, the Open Meetings Act, and the Freedom of Information Act
sections.text: Administrative support. The Governor's Office shall provide administrative support to the Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee as needed, including with respect to compliance with State ethics laws, the Open Meetings Act, and the Freedom of Information Act.

sections.heading: Meetings. The Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee shall hold at least 6 meetings each year, but otherwise shall meet at the call of the chair.
sections.text: Meetings. The Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee shall hold at least 6 meetings each year, but otherwise shall meet at the call of the chair.

sections.heading: Reports. The Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee shall submit an interim report to the Governor every 6 months and an annual report to the Governor and the General Assembly
sections.text: Reports. The Youth Homelessness Prevention Subcommittee shall submit an interim report to the Governor every 6 months and an annual report to the Governor and the General Assembly.
